metadata.title: CVE-2021-29454 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
Smarty is a template engine for PHP, facilitating the separation ofpresentation (HTML/CSS) from application logic. Prior to versions 3.1.42and 4.0.2, template authors could run arbitrary PHP code by crafting amalicious math string. If a math string was passed through as user provideddata to the math function, external users could run arbitrary PHP code bycrafting a malicious math string. Users should upgrade to version 3.1.42 or4.0.2 to receive a patch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

smarty3 - 3.1.34+20190228.1.c9f0de05+selfpack1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: smarty3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.34+20190228.1.c9f0de05+selfpack1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
